author: .vbuterin
content: I do think that realistically, if we're going anywhere at all we're going verkle at this point

author: .vbuterin
content: The reasoning is that with some recent analyses of concrete impacts of introducing code chunk gas cost, we're already brushing up against a hard wall in terms of the tradeoff between bounding witness size and not overcharging existing applications

author: .vbuterin
content: A cost of 200 gas per chunk (~6.25 gas per witness byte) increases *average* gas usage by ~25%

author: .vbuterin
content: So anything that has more-than-negligible overhead per code chunk is outright unviable, unfortunately
